summary.span: 表示要儲存在資料庫或自資料庫擷取之字元的可變長度資料流。

span.span: Represents a variable-length stream of characters to be stored in or retrieved from the database.

summary.span: 具有與其在 .NET Framework 中對應的 資料類型不同的基礎資料結構。

span.span: has a different underlying data structure from its corresponding .NET Framework data type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一律會使用預設值從目前的執行緒，但包含它自己的地區設定識別碼，並比較旗標。 always uses the default from the current thread, but contains its own locale Id and compare flags. 比較結果，兩個結構都是獨立的作業系統和目前執行緒的地區設定。The comparison result of two structures is independent of operating system and current thread locale. 當您使用比較運算子，請注意，是否不同的引數的 Lcid，比較函式擲回例外狀況因為無法進行比較。When you use comparison operators, note that if the LCIDs of arguments are different, comparison functions throw an exception because they cannot be compared. 例如，陳述式For example, the statement ``` SqlString mySqlString = new SqlString("abc"); ``` 相當於is equivalent to ``` SqlString mySqlString = new SqlString("abc", CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.LCID); ```

summary.span: 取得 結構，其表示有關這個 物件的文化特性 (Culture) 資訊。

span.span: Gets the structure that represents information about the culture of this object.

value.span: 結構，描述有關這個 SqlString 結構的文化特性資訊，包括文化特性的名稱、撰寫的系統和使用的曆法，也包括存取特定文化特性的物件，這些物件會為一般作業 (例如格式化日期及排序字串) 提供方法。

span.span: A structure that describes information about the culture of this SqlString structure including the names of the culture, the writing system, and the calendar used, and also access to culture-specific objects that provide methods for common operations, such as formatting dates and sorting strings.

public: static initonly int IgnoreKanaType;
staticval mutable IgnoreKanaType : int

summary.span: 指定字串比較必須忽略假名類型。

span.span: Specifies that the string comparison must ignore the Kana type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 假名類型意指日文平假名和片假名字元，表示日本語言中的語音。Kana type refers to Japanese hiragana and katakana characters that represent phonetic sounds in the Japanese language. 平假名用於本土日文的語句和字詞，而片假名則用於自其他語言引進的字詞，例如「computer」或「Internet」。Hiragana is used for native Japanese expressions and words, while katakana is used for words borrowed from other languages, such as "computer" or "Internet". 平假名和片假名都可以用來表達語音。A phonetic sound can be expressed in both hiragana and katakana. 如果選取這個值，就會將代表一個語音的平假名字元視為等於代表相同語音的片假名字元。If this value is selected, the hiragana character for one sound is considered equal to the katakana character for the same sound. 做為常數，類別。 functions as a constant for the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly int IgnoreNonSpace;
.field public static initonly int32 IgnoreNonSpace
Public Shared ReadOnly IgnoreNonSpace As Integer
public: static initonly int IgnoreNonSpace;
staticval mutable IgnoreNonSpace : int

summary.span: 指定字串比較必須忽略非空格組合的字元，例如變音符號 (Diacritic)。

span.span: Specifies that the string comparison must ignore non-space combining characters, such as diacritics.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Unicode Standard 將組合的字元定義為與基底字元結合以產生新字元的字元。The Unicode Standard defines combining characters as characters that are combined with base characters to produce a new character. 非空格組合的字元在呈現時本身並不會使用字元空間。Non-space combining characters do not use character space by themselves when rendered. 如需非空格組合字元的詳細資訊，請參閱 http://www.unicode.org 的＜Unicode 標準＞。For more information about non-space combining characters, see the Unicode Standard at http://www.unicode.org. 做為常數，類別。 functions as a constant for the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public static readonly int IgnoreWidth;
.field public static initonly int32 IgnoreWidth
Public Shared ReadOnly IgnoreWidth As Integer
public: static initonly int IgnoreWidth;
staticval mutable IgnoreWidth : int

summary.span: 指定字串比較必須忽略字元寬度。

span.span: Specifies that the string comparison must ignore the character width.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 例如，日文片假名字元可以書寫為全型或半型，而如果這個值被選取，片假名字元則書寫成全型並被視為相等於以半型書寫的相同字元。For example, Japanese katakana characters can be written as full-width or half-width and, if this value is selected, the katakana characters written as full-width are considered equal to the same characters written in half-width. 做為常數，類別。 functions as a constant for the class.
